result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick S Statham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derrick S Statham is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derrick S Statham was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight-Time.
Consecutive to: Sentence in Waukesha Co Case 22CT138.

Costs to be paid at $50.00 commencing on 30 days after being released from Custody and each month thereafter. To go along with payment plan in case 22CT138. 
Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

8:34 AM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Derrick S Statham.  Attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State is in compliance with victim's rights. 
Cases called for jury status in 22CM1171, but parties have come to a resolution. 
State places offer on the record. 
Court conducts plea colloquy.

In case 22CM1171:
Counts 1 & 2 are Dismissed.
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 3,  Court finds defendant guilty. 

In case 22CT138:
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. 

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

In case 22CT138:

JAIL: 60  Days - Straight-time.
0  Days Credit.
To be served consecutive to sentence in Waukesha County 15CF401.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 30 days after release from custody. 
Alternate:  Entry of civil judgment


*********************************************************

In case 22CM1171:

JAIL: 60  Days - Straight-time.
0  Days Credit.
To be served consecutive to sentence in Waukesha County 22CM1171.

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 30 days after release from custody. 
Alternate:  Entry of civil judgment

The trial is removed from the calendar.

Jury status hearing on August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:04 AM Defendant Derrick S Statham in court, in custody, with attorney Tyler A Jochman.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was set for plea and sentencing in 22CT138. 
The original offer from the state was revoked and a new offer was issued this morning. 
Defense has not received all of discovery in the new case.
Atty Jochman requests some time to discuss with his client.
Atty Jochman requests his motion to modify bond be heard.
Defendant has been unable to post thus far, he is also on a probation hold.
The State objects for reasons as placed on the record.
The Court denies the motion to modify bail for reasons placed on the record.
Bail remains as fixed.  
Defendant makes speedy trial demand. 
Both cases are set for jury status and trial in compliance with deadlines.
Court will issue a trial scheduling order. 


  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Motion to Modify Bail filed by Atty. Tyler Jochman.

  **Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 07/07/22--To be addressed at next hearing on 7/11.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
